body_html:
It's very strange but the JNI-build in my Android is using the most actual Tensorflow build in GitHub. I am not 100% if what I did was correct (I could not find any documentation on how to port Tensorflow to the JNI-build) but I am currently following the build from TensorflowAndroidMNIST. Here I just replaced the entire include/tensorflow with that from tensorflow/tensorflow and rebuilt the .so-file. As no errors were returned and the .so-file was generated, I assume it was done correctly. However, I still get the same error when attempting to load the file.

I also tried editing array_ops.cc in the original Tensorflow build then rebuilding the .so-file but I get the same result.

EDIT: I just realized that the Tensorflow files from TensorflowAndroidMNIST were extracted from the Tensorflow Android example app and not directly from Tensorflow itself. I will give an update tomorrow.

body:
It's very strange but the JNI-build in my Android is using the most actual Tensorflow build in GitHub. I am not 100% if what I did was correct (I could not find any documentation on how to port Tensorflow to the JNI-build) but I am currently following the build from [TensorflowAndroidMNIST](https://github.com/miyosuda/TensorFlowAndroidMNIST). Here I just replaced the entire `include/tensorflow` with that from `tensorflow/tensorflow` and rebuilt the .so-file. As no errors were returned and the .so-file was generated, I assume it was done correctly. However, I still get the same error when attempting to load the file.

I also tried editing `array_ops.cc` in the original Tensorflow build then rebuilding the .so-file but I get the same result.

 **EDIT:** I just realized that the Tensorflow files from [TensorflowAndroidMNIST](https://github.com/miyosuda/TensorFlowAndroidMNIST) were extracted from the Tensorflow Android  example app and not directly from Tensorflow itself. I will give an update tomorrow.
